page.title: 10THE SCHOOL IN THE PAST
page.content: Rebecca Fagg, a current pupil. When grandma went to school the children stayed there until they left. Now at the age of eleven they transfer to the secondary school in Lenham. The girls used to go to Harrietsham School on the train for cookery lessons one day a week while the boys did gardening on the opposite side of the road where Troys Mead council houses now stand. There was no school field as this was still Church Meadow and the playground was divided into a boys and girls area seperated by a wall. The toilets were outside and are now used as storage sheds. The headmaster lived in the school house, now the school offices,and the infant teacher in the school flat which is not used at present but it is hoped to turn this into a museum.
